content: Could some admin create a new invite link and post it to reddit at https://www.reddit.com/r/compsci/comments/ihozur/new_applied_category_theory_server/ ?
Here is a link: https://categorytheory.zulipchat.com/join/qgnp8gd3feuxyf9rj5tpy6rm/
Thanks, will post.
Can we generate another one? Someone's asking for one over on the HoTT Zulip.
https://categorytheory.zulipchat.com/join/krf6f8ocdsnwgbbdle5dh548/
Could we get a link to the HoTT Zulip?
Do you need a special link? I joined somehow and I'm not sure I had one. https://hott.zulipchat.com I could just have forgotten that I had one, though.
It worked, thanks!
Cool.
The link on https://johncarlosbaez.wordpress.com/2020/03/25/category-theory-community-server/ expired again. Can we generate a new one?
Yes, I'll do it in a minute...

Here you go:

https://categorytheory.zulipchat.com/join/oglymtld3os4kxq4mm2qc7pf/

I'll also update it on the blog.
Tnanks!!! =)
That link is expired again. Can we have a new one?
Also, surely there must be a better way to do this?

@Matteo Capucci and I tried to write a bot which would do it, but after a 3 hour session trying and failing to set up a python environment in which we could run the relevant libraries to write the bot programme, we gave up :upside_down:
So for the time being, Matteo is that bot.
There is always a fresh link in https://categorytheory.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/229122-general.3A-meta/topic/invite.20link.
Great! Thanks!
:robot:
Apparently the problem now is that nobody is noticing the links I post every week
I've updated the stream message for #general, which gives it a bit more visibility.
Nobody notices you when you're a bot. This is one of the grievances that will lead to the robot uprising

Nathanael Arkor said:

I've updated the stream message for #general, which gives it a bit more visibility.

Great move! I didn't think it was possible to put links in the message.
